intro: Microula ciliaris, commonly known as the Kashmiri sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has a shallow root system and is often found in regions with limited water availability. Microula ciliaris is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
